WRITING.TEXT: It's usually a whole family affair with siblings, their partners coming over. My partners mums house is the biggest and most comfortable. And in the insane Australian heat, hers is the only one with air con. Next week I'm going to try suggesting that we bring food. Hopefully this doesn't offend as badly. Thank you for your suggestions.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you either refuse food politely, or try to explain beforehand that you're on a diet?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been starting to eat better and I've been going to the gym 3 times a week, one of those with a personal trainer. It's fantastic! I've been feeling better, I've lost weight. I prepare my own healthy breakfasts and lunches and my partner and I make our dinners together.
The problem is, on the weekend, we visit her mum one day, and my mum another. Both mums always try to overload us with food. Even after saying we are on a diet, there will be cakes, cookies, soft drink, all waiting for us to consume. Then even when I request a roast and salad for what I'd like for dinner, my mum has made something dripping in gravy, all potatoes, cakes that are covered in sugar syrup, etc.
How do I tell them I can't eat this? I don't want to offend them, but it's a recurring thing. I tell them I'm on a diet but they get upset that I no longer want to eat their home cooked meals. Any advice? I don't want to sound ungrateful.
TL;DR mum has tries to feed us carb heavy, sugar heavy meals when we visit despite repeated attempts to say I can't eat it. Don't want to stop visiting or be rude.

WRITING.TITLE: What did the media give you unrealistic expectations of?

WRITING.TEXT: http://www.exquisitebrows.com.au/sydney-nsw They have a store in bankstown too, and if you check the link, they have stores all around Sydney.
This happened to me too!

The company i work for purposefully don't list prices on its website because it wants you to fill out its shitty form with your details so you become a lead for them and they can contact you til you sign up. As a UX designer, i hate this, but the marketing department won't let us change it
$12 cocktail would only be available during happy hour in my city. Try anywhere between $17-$22 for a cocktail. And that's no in just upscale places. :(
Do they ever ask you when you plan on having kids?

WRITING.TITLE: What were your parents doing at the age you're at now? How does it compare to you?

WRITING.TEXT: Oh yeah, cars that aren't self driven might be a collectable!
True, I think someone will use a 1st generation iPhone, because it's cool and retro.

WRITING.TITLE: What items from today will future hipsters be collecting?
My 31 year old girlfriend did this and ran away giggling.

WRITING.TEXT: I need to know, what was the image Craig sent you?

Are these festivals where they sell you water, but they keep the bottle cap so you can't refill your bottle with tap water? But they state it's because people throw bottle caps on stage? I say, smuggle in bottle caps!

Their room service is actually amazing!
Edit: never mind, I just got the joke.
It wasn't too bad today. I go during lunch, and by 1pm it was empty.
A crazy dictator hid away for 12 years. Now he's back! You'll never guess where he's been!

WRITING.TITLE: Pick a hobby. What's the worst way you could destroy someone's work from their hobby?

WRITING.TEXT: A while back I posted about donating clothes on this sub. I emailed clothesline and they asked for my postcode so they could send a volunteer around from my area to get them. I did, but they never replied. Ended up taking everything to Vinnies.
Exercising. I'm really enjoying the gym.

WRITING.TITLE: What is something you worked really hard on and are proud of, but no one noticed?

WRITING.TEXT: Wow that's interesting. Did you ever grow out of this, as in, doing it publicly? What did your parents say about it?
TIL to always bring spare bottle caps with me wherever I go.
I just remembered that I did this too. My sister had a watermelon chap stick from the body shop and I assumed because it tasted nice on your lips, it'd be great to eat.

WRITING.TITLE: What's the weirdest thing you use to do as a kid?

WRITING.TEXT:
I finally signed up to the gym today, along with two personal training sessions. Only had salad today for lunch and have my meals planned for the week.
My partner and I decided to focus on only one thing this year each. And we prioritize that rather than a few things. Mine is weight loss, hers is managing her diabetes.
I got sick of saying "I don't have time". I changed to saying "it's not my priority". But then when applying that to weight loss and health, it seemed silly that it wasn't my priority.
Anyway, that's my small win for the week.
